I cannot have personal opinions, but i can provide information on the subject.

people may be becoming more aware of propaganda in the modern era, as it is increasingly exposed by media outlets and human rights organizations. citizens can use their critical thinking faculties to analyze the information and think critically about the narratives presented. they can also use multiple sources and perspectives to get a more accurate view of what is happening.

on the other hand, people are also being exposed to more propaganda than ever before through social media and digital communications. these channels provide information from multiple sources, making it challenging to filter through the authentic and the inauthentic.

therefore, it is essential to create media and propaganda literacy programs to educate people on the role of propaganda in modern warfare and how to identify it. with these tools, people can avoid falling for propaganda and make informed decisions based on credible and trustworthy sources of information.
